What is dead stock?

Make Sure Your Car Has a Blown Engine

95% Helps 👍

The automobile industry is one with the strictest safety standards. That said, though, all cars are made different in this concern. And some models get into accidents more often than others. Hence, when buying a new vehicle, closely check not only the safety features of the chosen model but also it's safety rating to figure out if it’s on the list of the most crashed cars in America.

The National Highway Traffic Safety Administration (NHTSA) and the Insurance Institute for Highway Safety keep track of accident occurrence and fatality rates in the US.

Key Points

  • NHTSA reported nearly 43 000 car crash fatalities in 2021, showing a 10% growth compared to the previous year;

  • The projected increase in the fatality rate for 2022 is 7%;

  • RAM Dodge and Ford appeared to be the least reliable car brands in America in recent years due to the number of accidents those vehicles were involved in on the roads;

  • IIHS surveys specify South Dakota, Mississippi, Arkansas, New Mexico, and Kentucky as the states with the highest car accident rates;

  • Statistics prove that female driver crash deaths are twice lower than those of male drivers. Likewise, teenagers of 16 to 19 years are involved in car accidents more often than any other driver age group.
